msContents.summary: Receipt for 100 drachmas for the annona militum, paid by a high priest, Bitharion. The tax may have been paid to a female tax collector

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; back blank
The hand is a medium-sized, fluent cursive

div.ab: The 3rd year of our lords Valerianus and Gallienus Augusti, the month of Choiak. Aurelius Bitharion, also called Eudaimon, high-priest, paid to the apaitetai (=collectors) of the western toparchy [l. 5] for the annona of 12,000 soldiers one hundred drachmas, totals 100 drachmas. At the estate of Ptolemais, through me, [l. 10] Thonis overseer and member of the town senate, it has been signed.

listBibl.bibl: P.Princ. II 50 BL VIII, 284 and IX, 219 P. J. Sijpesteijn, "P.Princeton II 50 and the Number of Soldiers in Egypt," ZPE 65 (1986): 168 B. Palme, N. Lewis, "Notationes Legentis," BASP 27 (1990): 40 P. J. Sijpesteijn, "Another Female Tax Collector," ZPE 64 (1986): 121-122
